_meanings:
{@--1@} (Used with roots
and nouns in the sense of) Placing
near or over, taking towards, 
uniting with; reaching or going up to,
proximity, nearness &c. [Cf. <ab>Gr.</ab>
{%epi%}, Zend {%api%}, <ab>Germ.</ab> and <ab>Eng.</ab> {%be%}].
(Note. {#api#}, as a prefix to roots, occurs
mostly in Veda, its place being taken
by {#aBi#} in classical literature).

{@--10@} It sometimes
expresses ‘doubt’ or ‘uncertainty,’
‘fear’ ({#SaMkA#}); {#api coro Bavet#} <ls>G. M.</ls>
there is perhaps a thief.

{@--12@} Contempt, 
censure, or reproof; <ls>P. I. 4. 96</ls>,  
<ls n="P.">III. 3. 142</ls>; {#Digdevadattamapi stuyAdvfzalaM; DigjAlmaM#}
{#devadattamapi siMcet palAMquM; api jAyAM#} 
{#tyajasi jAtu gaRikAmADatse garhitametat#} <ls>Sk.</ls>
shame to, &c. or fie upon, Devadatta
&c.

{@--13@} It is also used with the 
Imperative mood to mark ‘indifference
on the part of the speaker’, where
he permits another to do as he likes,
({#anvavasarga#} or {#kAmacArAnujYA#}, the imperative
being softened;) {#api stuhi#} <ls>Sk.</ls> you 

may praise (if you like); {#api stuhyapi#}
{#seDAsmAMstaTyamuktaM narASana#} <ls>Bk. 8. 92.</ls>

{@--14@} {#api#} is sometimes used as a 
particle of exclamation,

{@--15@} Rarely in the
sense of ‘therefore,’ ‘hence’ ({#ata eva#}).

{@--16@} Used as a separable preposition
with <ab>gen.</ab> it is said to express the
sense of a word understood ({#padArTa#}),
and is treated as a {#karmapravacanIya#}  
<ls>P. I. 4. 96</ls>; the example usually given is
{#sarpizopi syAt#} where some word like
{#biMdurapi#} ‘a drop,’ ‘a little’ &c.
has to be understood, ‘there may
perhaps be a drop of ghee,’ ‘I 
presume there may be at least a drop’
&c. {#api saMBAvanApraSnaSaMkAgarhAsamuccaye .#} 
{#taTAyuktapadArTezu kAmacArakriyAsu ca ..#} <ls>Viśva.</ls>; {#apiH#}
{#padArTasaMBAvanAnvavasargagarhAsamuccayezu#} <ls>P. I. 4. 96.</ls>
<ls>G. M.</ls> adds the senses of {#ASis#} 
‘blessing’ {#(Badramapi), mfti#} ‘death’ ({#maraRamapi#})
and {#BUzA#} ‘decoration’ ({#api na hyati hAraM#}).
